user.biography:
Marine biologist, policy nerd, Brooklyn native. 
Co-founder 🏙 @UrbanOceanLab. Co-host🎙@how2saveaplanet. Co-editor 📖 @AllWeCanSave.

node.text:
Thank you to the House Natural Resources Committee for inviting me to testify on the Ocean-Based Climate Solutions Act. 

I was so nervous! But couldn't miss this opportunity to champion the ocean. Because, as I concluded: 

"The ocean can be a core element of our climate solutions – sequestering carbon, protecting coastal communities, producing clean energy, providing nutritious seafood, and providing millions of jobs.

Frankly, we have not been giving the ocean the respect it deserves, and that must change. Trying to address the climate crisis without including the ocean is simply a recipe for failure."

Thank you @repraulgrijalva for sponsoring this bill, and also for your leadership on environmental justice. Thank you @jeanflemma, my @urbanoceanlab co-founder, for helping me to prep. And shoutout to @minca, leader of @azuldotorg, who testified along with me. 

This bit is my formal testimony and then (eek!) responded to questions from members of Congress. You can watch the full hearing on the House Natural Resource Committee Democrat's YouTube channel – link in bio and: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Dr9F9fDRBo

#BlueNewDeal #OceanClimateAction #OceanJustice

node.title: Congressional Testimony: Ocean-Based Climate Solutions Act

node.text:
*The* @StaceyAbrams. 😮🥰

Voting rights are critical for ensuring #ClimateJustice. Americans — especially people of color — want strong government action on climate solutions. 

When everyone can access their right to vote, we elect people who prioritize the environment, and then we get stronger climate policy. Protecting democracy *is* climate action.

Fun fact: Stacey’s undergraduate thesis was on environmental justice! And her org The Southern Economic Advancement Project (@the.seap) just published a report on decarbonization policies in southern states. She’s an OG who has been in this work for *decades.*

Huge thanks to @worldwarzeroorg for making this beyond-my-dreams #EarthDay event happen.

node.title: Earth Day IG Live with Stacey Abrams

node.text:
How can you be a part of climate solutions? I sat down with @billieeilish for a conversation about speaking up, taking action, and shifting the culture.

Learn what *you* can do: https://go.nike.com/talkingtrash

node.title: Think Global, Act Local with Billie Eilish | Talking Trash | Nike

node.text:
We’re in this together. Home stretch. It’s normal to feel overwhelmed — this election is wild and the stakes are so high! 

So instead of just FaceTiming, @sophiabush and I thought we’d have a public convo about this huge moment. 

Stay connected. We can do this. Make sure everyone you know has a plan to vote. Info at: iwillvote.com.

node.text:
This is a @drkwilkinson appreciation post. 💛

Co-creating the @allwecansave anthology with Katharine was the only time I’ve ever had a group project actually be 50/50. 🤓

She is a big-hearted grammar nerd, a poetic to-do list dissolver, an analytical empath, a visionary who rolls up her sleeves. 

Per one of our favorite quotes we wove into #AllWeCanSave: 

“There must be those among whom we can lay down and weep, and still be counted as warriors.” — Adrienne Rich

Seeking more wisdom from women climate leaders? We got you. 📚 

@drkwilkinson and I teamed up with @bookshop_org to curate lists of other nonfiction and poetry writings by @allwecansave anthology contributors. 

There is *so much more* where #AllWeCanSave came from. ✨ Beach reading conundrum solved! 

Links in stories… or just head to bookshop.org. #AddToCart

node.text:
The Ocean Justice Forum (which I co-lead) is looking for a facilitator. If you know someone amazing please have them apply. 

Ocean Justice Forum is co-convened by @urbanoceanlab @americanprogress @azuldotorg @gcclp. 

More about OJF: oceanjusticeforum.info 

Apply: www.urbanoceanlab.org/opportunities (link in bio — I’m not fielding Qs but we do have a legit budget and all key info is there.)

#OceanJustice 💙

node.text:
🇯🇲🥇🇯🇲🥈🇯🇲🥉

Missing my Jamaican dad right now, knowing he would have whooped and hollered and clapped and been just delighted at this SWEEP. 💪🏾

And Thompson-Herah set a new Olympic record: 10.61 seconds — fastest woman alive. 

CONGRATULATIONS!!!
✨ @fastelaine 
✨ @realshellyannfp 
✨ @sherickajacko

node.text:
Still aglow from this fête @themeteor threw for @allwecansave — feminists and climate feminists unite! 💛✨

Thank you @cindi_leive, @heathercmcghee, and @amberrosetamblyn for hosting, gathering the dopest crew, saying such lovely things about our work, and making sure we actually took time to celebrate. 🥂📖 

Shoutouts to @swellbottle for sponsoring and @celestinebklyn for the perfect venue. 💫 And to bestie @maherkr who spent a whole day on trains and ferries to be there with me.

📸 @belathee

P.s.  if you’re not already following @themeteor go do it now! I’m a proud founding member 💪🏽

node.text: Thank you @feminist for featuring @allwecansave and for this lovely interview. (Link in bio!)

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Dr. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson on July 30, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Climate change is a feminist Issue.'.

Photo by Dr. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson on July 30, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'WOMEN ARE ONE OF THE MOST VULNERABLE GROUPS IN CLIMATE CHANGE, IN YOUR OPINION WOULD YOU AGREE? IF so, WHY? AEJ: Luckily, do not have to rely on my opinion. It is robustly supported by evidence that women are disproportionately more vulnerable to climate change. This is true from New Orleans to Bangladesh. The most concise explanation is that climate change exacerbates existing inequalities, placing the most risk on those who are already vulnerable.'.

Photo by Dr. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson on July 30, 2021. May be an image of 3 people and text that says 'In 1991 during the cyclone disasters in Bangladesh, of the 140,000 people who died, 90% were women (Ikeda, 1995).'.

user.full_name: The All We Can Save Project

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Dr. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson on July 30, 2021 tagging @allwecansave. May be an image of text that says 'WHAT DOES BEING A FEMINIST MEAN TO YOU? AEJ: It means uplifting the voices of women doing important work on climate solutions, and throwing open the doors for more women to join us. This is a core element of the work of The All We Can Save Project, the nonprofit Katharine and I co-founded to carry forward the work that is unfurling from the anthology. The climate crisis is an all-hands-on-deck moment for humanty;it requires the full brilliance and ingenuity of our species. And that, obviously, must include women.'.

Photo shared by Dr. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson on July 30, 2021 tagging @drkwilkinson. May be an image of text that says 'WHAT SPARKED YOUR INTEREST TO CREATE ALL WE CAN SAVE? A.E.J.: Frustration and rage. There are so many brilliant, innovative, and effective women doing climate work whose expertise is gnored and whose work is not being resourced If society continues to ignore these voices, we will simply fail at addressing the climate crisis. So, because my co-editor Dr. Katharine Wilkinson and I are dorks, we thought an anthology might help.''.
Photo shared by Dr. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson on July 30, 2021 tagging @madeleine_jubilee_saito. May be an image of text.

Photo by Dr. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson on July 30, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'HOW DID YOU FIND YOUR VOICE? AEJ: Trial and error. And not being cool as a kid was a huge gift. node.text:
We launched the @allwecansave anthology in paperback 🚀 with a glorious gathering — honest, joyful, incisive, forward looking. 

ICYMI, the video is up on @Patagonia’s YouTube, where it was live-streamed. 📺 Link in bio! 

Featuring Dr. Kate Marvel (who is the funniest climate scientist of all time), @heathermcteertoney, @eyeampierre, Dr. Leah Stokes, and @favianna1 (whose incredible art set the vibe ✨). 

@drkwilkinson and I hosted this bi-coastal book event in NYC and Jenna Johnson, head of Patagonia Inc., hosted in LA. 🎤 

Thank goodness for @how2saveaplanet that my hosting skills weren’t too rusty. And I definitely hid behind some plants, introvert style, as guests were arriving. 🪴 

HUGE thank you to Patagonia for being an *incredible* partner — from production to promotion, from books to snacks. 

P.s. Let’s launch feminist climate anthologies instead of billionaire rocket toys. @bethsawin with the perfect tweet as always — go follow her on Twitter

node.text:
Learning to swim changed my life. Not just because it led to me becoming a marine biologist. But because I’ve always​ felt comfortable and happy in and around ​the ​water.

As a kid I was always *extremely* excited about pool parties – especially ones at the @YMCA, because that was the biggest pool with the deepest deep end! (And yes, I was definitely warned more than once not to run on the pool deck – safety first!)

Currently in the U.S., ​it's Black ​children ​who have the fewest chances to learn to swim and the highest rate of drowning​. This is a legacy of racism, of generations of Black folks being excluded from pools and beaches. ​And ​i​f a parent does not know how to swim, there is only a 13% chance that their child will learn.

To break that cycle, I'm teaming up with the @YMCA to encourage you to get swim lessons for the kiddos in your life. The Y has a Safety Around Water program that teaches kids essential water safety skills for free or at minimal cost, which can open up a world of possibilities for them to satisfy their curiosity, safely.

​Just think of how much more diverse the field of marine science would be if more kids had the chance to learn to swim — and how much more we would know about the ocean if a broader diversity of people were ​designing marine research. And how much more *effective* ​ocean conservation would be if the experts were as diverse as the coastal communities where they work, let alone as diverse as marine ecosystems​.

That all starts with learning to swim. I’m so lucky that my parents knew how, and taught me.

The self-​discovery and self​-​awe of learning to swim​ are the​ purest of delight​s.​ ​That feeling of confidence that comes from competence​... I wish that for every child. Total game changer. ​

Coach: Dad 💙
Photo: Mom 💙

#SafetyAroundWater #JustKeepSwimming #YMCAPartner
